summary: Email correspondence from an MCC staff member forwarding complaints from Jeffrey Epstein's attorneys regarding his conditions at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, including lack of toilet paper, unplugged CPAP machine, and limited phone access. The email shows administrative concerns about Epstein's detention shortly before his death.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was detained at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York as of August 6, 2019.
Epstein's attorneys complained about inadequate conditions including no toilet paper in his cell and his CPAP machine not being plugged in.
Epstein had only been able to make two fifteen-minute phone calls since arriving at MCC, both on speaker phone with officers present.
The email correspondence shows administrative concerns about Epstein's detention conditions just days before his death on August 10, 2019.
Epstein was represented by the Law Offices of Michael Lambert, with attorney Manel Colon handling the complaint.
